characters: OUTER PLANETS OF OUR SOLAR SYSTEM
BACK TO THE HAWKMEN AND OTHERS IN SKY
BACK TO MAIN PART OF FOREST
SPACE BETWEEN TWO TERRACES/ ONE TERRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first only darkness, then the rising sun paints in an endless savanna from horizon to horizon. We hear savage d beating in the distance coming from some unknown place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun clears the horizon. Suddenly it changes amazingly the white disc goes through a rapid series of color transitions, from yellow to green to purple to an incredi BLOOD RED. From it shoots a RED LIGHTNING BOLT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky echoes with THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a HOWLING ethereal wind, but not a twig of the br stirs as bolt after bolt of RED LIGHTNING rips the sky, w each one a TITLE or CREDIT appearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under FINAL CREDIT snow is beginning to fall on the burni blood-red savanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I's a Twin Otter with the logo of some commuter airline. buzzes along over pleasant countryside, through a sky tha almost unnaturally serene and filled with fleecy white cl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are just two passengers in the cabin. One is DALE A a great looking dark-haired girl sitting by herself and reading a book entitled "KARATE FOR THE SINGLE GIRL.... A Guide to Survival In The City." A few rows forward, near open door into the pilots' compartment, is FLASH GORDON. He's studying a football play-sheet, one of those diagram things with X's and 0's for the players and dotted-line a indicating the directions of movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the plane makes a violent bump. It almost knocks the book from DALE'S hand. She looks out the window with sudden fright, tossing hair out of her eyes, in a gesture that's habitual to her in moments of stress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to see outside but the pretty clouds. She looks forward again and watches FLASH standing up easily, leaning in t..e cockpit doorway to speak to the PILOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CO-P:ILOT, DALE, FLASH, PILOT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that, fellas? 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear-air turbulence, is all. Nothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nothing you'd want to toss a third-down pass through either -- (Grinning back at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have an autograph for my kid, Mr. Gordon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure -- my pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As FLASH takes a bit of paper from the CO-PILOT, the plan takes another jolt, even more violent than the first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Call Westchester Approach, see what they've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure hope we don't have to turn back. I mean this is first day of training camp, I wouldn't want to be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seat-belt time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH starts back to his seat. The plane jumps again, shu violently. He holds on, calls up front:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it'd be smoother if you went

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you SHUT UP? (as FLASH's head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mister Flash Gordon, they have their hands full -- just let 'em drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane buffets. FLASH is sent reeling, catches hold of the rack above DALE, lowers himself into the seat next to her. He buckles fast, takes out a candy bar and offers it to her. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're nervous, it can help to chew on something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot -- I look dumb enough to take candy from a stranger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a stranger exactly -- You know my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who doesn't. Number one draft pick, cover of PEOPLE mag -- what'd the GIANTS sign you for, eighty-nine million? Big deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I hate flying -- I'm Dale Arden it's crazy of me to hate flying -- I'm a travel agent, you see? -- I've just been checking out a little hotel in Vermont -- can I still have that candy bar? (and in the same breath) Are we going backward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backwards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy cow! Look at the clouds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pretty white clouds are changing above and beginning surround the airplane. Over the engines we HEAR that same ethereal wind rising which we heard in the opening. Slowl and terrifyingly, the sun starts turning BLOOD RED. The c race faster, faster, until they are actually streaming pa the plane from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and DALE -- faces bathed in the eerie light. Speech DALE grasps the football player's hand with all her stren

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a huge and rambling, antique, standing in semiruino isolation in a pretty country landscape. The sun has turn 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the SAME BLOOD RED we saw from the airplane, and clouds r across it with unnatural velocity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the greenhouse rises a glass-paned tower through which we glimpse something MIRROR BRIGHT. Floatin high in the air above the structure are several silvery h filled balloons, secured by wires. As we move closer, we discern a MAN moving about actively on a platform inside central tower, about half-way up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MUNSON, TV NEWSMAN, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is DR. HANS ZARKOV: big, bearded, feverish lookin and seemingly half mad with exhaustion. In striking contr to the antique greenhouse exterior, here there are all ki of computers and displays connected together in a slapdas fashion. Quantities of neglected plants, most brown and dead or dying, hide the works in here from outside view. Zarkov runs around throwing switches and eyeing displays, grim-voiced TV. NEWSMAN is appearing and speaking from a good-sized television screen above the main control conso

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The extraordinary weather disturbances reported from Africa this morning are now crossing the Atlantic, and are expected to reach the East Coast of the United States by noon. According to scientists at NASA, the Earth is being struck by an immense stream of cosmic energy, apparently the result of some catastrophic stellar accident beyond the reaches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV whirls, slams the TV SOUND OFF and yells at the silently mouthing NEWSMAN on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fools! Can't you understand? This is no accident-- it's an ATTACK! An attack planned by a MIND! This is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUNSON, a scared looking assistant, comes running up the stairs with a computer print-out sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Zarkov! Look at the report from the last balloon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV grabs it, eyes it. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I predicted it, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir -- you sure did. And this funny sun too ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozone layer starting to crack up. By tonight Carbon dioxide will be combining with free nitrogen to form -- (breaks off, crumpling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the President is on the TV behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do I care? I tried to warn him -- he called me mad, like all the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! The TV screen EXPLODES in a fine shower of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for us to go, Munson. Get your toothbrush and whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up. Up and at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, MUNSON turns his head and glances at something b and MIRROR BRIGHT gleaming behind foliage in center of to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfectly calm except for the maniacal glint in his eyes, ZARKOV pulls out a revolver and points it at MUNSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't handle the capsule alone get your toothbrush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CO-PILOT, PILOT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOTS watch these clouds also, transfixed with disbe They speak with that incredible calmness characteristic o professional airmen in a moment of impending catastrophe. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's ,e word from Westchester Approach, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zip. All chanels dead. (Reacting to the panel) Say, get a load of the VOR's....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The directional needles are going crazy. All the instrume are going crazy. Displays flash impossible symbols. The PILOT gapes at them a moment, then returns his gaze to th sky and swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the left, about six o'clock high......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The racing stream of clouds is parting open like in some surreal painting. From the cortex LASER-like bolts of RED LIGHTNING shoot out. Like a missile, one zaps right over plane's nose with a horrible crackling NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on tight, let's put baby down right here......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CO-PILOT reaches up and hits the flap control. There a whooshing crackling ZAP! The whole cockpit FLARES OUT with an intolerable blinding flash of RED LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cockpit door flys off its hinges, admitting a gale of wind that scatters FLASH'S play sheets like autumn leaves FLASH unsnaps his belt, leaps up and races forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWO PILOTS are gone, vanished without trace. Wind fro the shattered windows assaults FLASH as he charges in. He stumbles forward as the plane noses into a dive. Recoveri he scrambles into the left-hand seat, grabs hold of the bucking wheel yoke, pulls back and kicks at the rudder pe DALE lurches in against the tornado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fly it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can fly all right -- I've had a couple of lessons! -- just don't if I can land!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab that other wheel! Help me pull her up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE staggers into the co-pilot's seat, pulls back on the wheel in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy! Ever hear about the man who fell ninety stories from a window and didn't break a bone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No but I'd sure like to! How'd The man fall ninety stories didn't break a bone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window was ninety-one stories up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Earth is approaching fast, wheeling and tilting. We g a glimpse of a strange greenhouse structure at the end of flat area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another barrage of crackling RED LIGHTNING BOLTS shoot al around the plane but just miss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brace yourself I'm aiming at that field up ahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its thousands of panes reflect the RED SUN and the RED BO which rain down in intermittent bursts. One strikes an en of a gallery, exploding glass and foliage. From inside, w HEAR a furious echoing VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you, Munson! Come out or I shoot! 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MUNSON, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV is on the lower stairs of the tower, aiming his revolver. MUNSON emerges from some dry brown bush where h was hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's it matter if I'm shot or go up in that thing? I'm a goner either way, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course -- I admit that! But this way you'll be giving your life for a chance of saving Earth! Haven't you any spirit at all??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Doctor -- they were all right about you. Have a nice trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUNSON starts walking away, toward the door at the end of the long side wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you I can't take it off alone! If you won't come, who will I find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you woo't come, who will I find:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUNSON ignores him totally, keeps walking away. ZARKOV li his revolver and draws a bead on the man's back. Just as is about to shoot, he reacts to something outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazingly, a Twin Otter is gliding in to a horribly rough landing in the field outside. The plane hits on one wheel bounces into the air, comes down again and keeps right on rolling toward the greenhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEEING the onrushing plane, freezing an instant then star to run. He hardly gets five yards before the Twin Otter c SLAMMING IN through the greenhouse wall, burying MUNSON totally under the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazily angled, filled with dust and smoke. Dazed, blood his forehead, FLASH struggles from his seat. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale! Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash Gordon, you have just made me a Giant fan for life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- let's get out before she blows!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH helps her from the wrecked seat, wheels and kicks o the emergency exit in the cockpit area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH lowers DALE to the ground, jumps down after her. ZA is there, smiling at them in a strange way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. i'm Flash Gordon, this is Miss Dale Arden --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delighted to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This crazy storm knocked us down could we use a phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly. Just follow me -- up those stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some weather huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will get worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV turns and smiles at them again as they start up th tower stairs. SUddenly DALE stops short, staring at ZARKO with a funny expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Dr. Hans Zarkov!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV hesitates just an instant, the nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know? 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you in PEOPLE mag. After you left NASA, remember? It said you were utterly ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE breaks off, almost biting her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insane? Off my rocker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forget what it said:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash, let's find some other phone, okay? I'm sure Dr. Zarkov is very busy.......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH is baffled, but he gets her urgent look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all right -- but it seems to me we ought to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's FLASH'S turn to break off. ZARKOV is pointing a gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the stairs to the tower! Ahead of me -- quick! -- (as they gape at him,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick I said: We haven't much time -- Earth is being attacked! -- there's only one slim chance of saving it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, you are insane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOWL of ether-wind increases. Storm of RED LASER BOLTS. G showers them as parts of the green house EXPLODE and dry foliage bursts into FLAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the stairs -- RUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV jabs the revolver into DALE'S back. RED BOLTS zap around. FLASH whispers to her as they start running up ah of ZARKOV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with the flow -- wait for a chance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below them, bottom of staircase disintergrates in a RED F 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV rips away a screen of foliage, revealing a MIRROR BRIGHT capsule, seamless but for one door. He yanks that open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On every side things are blowing up and burning under the merciless rain of bolts. One strikes the capsule head on, but does not even leave a mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help to take off! Get in or I shot you dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE gasps and shrinks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off for where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God only knows -- whatever black corner of space this is coming from -- wherever HE is!. -- we'll plunge into the devil's heart and destroy him! We'll die ourselves, of course, but our names will be honored till the end of time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Doc -- I don't book kamikaze tours -- never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH is poised to jump, but ZARKOV suddenly pushes DALE balance, INTO the capsule. FLASH leaps after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is curiously transparent from the inside, mirrored onl on the exterior. There are some controls and displays, bu in general the interior is severely ascetic: as far remov from conventional spacecraft as ZARKOV's solitary genius from everyday science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately starting to set switches in a frenzy of activ ZARKOV waves the gun at FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down there! Foot on the red pedal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash! Sack him! 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV wheels and pulls the door shut. FLASH jumps him. H punches ZARKOV in the gut. ZARKOV slams him back with the well-known strength of a madman. FLASH clobbers him again Falling, ZARKOV dives sidewards and hits a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The capsule WHINES SOFTLY and begins to WHIRL. Looking ou through the transparent wall, it is as if the capsule its was motionless and the scene outside is whirling. What's left of the greenhouse is under a constant rain of those LASER BOLTS, flashing fire that makes us dizzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH staggers to his feet and finds DALE, folds his arms around her protectively. The centrifugal force is rapidly increasing now, throws them both against the wall. Faster and faster, whirling, the force presses DALE'S body back against FLASH'S until they are almost one flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move over and find ZARKOV plastered against another pa of the whirling capsule, his face drained white and disto by the terrific G-Force operating here now, his lips movi as he speaks with enormous effort:

dialogues.speaker: ZARKOV,
dialogues.text: Friendship...Built this to send to them in...Friendship...The end now...End of the world....Unless we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (every sound an effort

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless...We...Three...Can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV'S eyes close. He loses consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally ablaze within now, one huge fantastic jewel of fi The whole central tower explodes outward. From the infern MIRROR-BRIGhT capsule slowly rises, hovers, begins pickin up speed again as it ascends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whirling, whirling, invincibly unharmed by the LASER BOLT which glance off it again and again, accelerating up into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EARTH recedes below into a ball, RED-HUED' under the fantastic sun. A fast approaching light FLARES up against the mirrored surface and is recognised as our MOON. It fl past, follows EARTH into e distance. All around, the sky darkens into the void of space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hurtle past the capsule in rapid sequences:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden gauntlet of careening ASTEROIDS, all sizes, from tiny zingers to one almighty tumbler big as AFRICA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mammoth JUPITER with thirteen moons and its atmosphere of deadly methane clouds more than 1000 miles deep. The RED PATCH on its surface is a storm 20,000 miles across which has raged without intermission for 200 EARTH centuries. Through the RINGS OF SATURN in a dazzling LIGHTSTORM of blazing ice crystals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEPTUNE, PLUTO, outermost URANUS. One after another the planets are left hurtling behind, wheeling in their conce orbits, the entire SOLAR SYSTEM dwindling into nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It tilts and wheels wondrously as the Capsule passes thro the middle of it. Considering that this Nebula is probabl million light-years from edge to edge, we get some notion the Capsule's speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curving light-rays from another galaxy are drawn fantasti together and then simply DISAPPEAR as they are pulled in the unimaginable gravitation force of is THING. we SEE th CAPSULE, tiny, curving, and spinning along amidst the min blowing display of light rays, sucked along with them В·В then simply DISAPPEARING as it too enters the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (KLYTUS, MING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visible again, gleaming in an AMBER GLOW. Suddenly a danc grid of lines appears OVER IT, making us realise that we must be SEEING IT on some kind of screen. It BLURS out of focus, comes back again more sharply as some adjustment h apparently been made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep in shadow, gleaming with evil amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curve of lip, flare of nostril, fold of eyelid, gleam of shaven scalp, each a menacing landscape of sensual shadow

dialogues.speaker: MING, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: They survived our Black Hole -- 14.

dialogues.speaker: KLYTUS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hail Ming! Shall I drown them in the Sea of Fire?

dialogues.speaker: MING, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Later, Klytus -- I think we will look at them first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the transparent walls as the spinning motion is rapidly SLOWING DOWN. The three voyagers are crumpled on floor against the wall in strange attitudes, FLASH'S arms still holding DALE. They seem semi-conscious, as if dropp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AMBER GLOW bathes them, and soon we see its source. A huge planet wheels into view through the transparent wall It is MONGO. Its curved surface is a pure sea of AMBER FI molten lava, with great tongues of flame erupting horrifically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV blinks, struggles to focus his eyes. He succeeds, with horror SEES where they are headed. Making a choking sound, ZARKOV stirs and tries to crawl over to a control panel. He pushes switches. Nothing happens. The CAPSULE keeps on going down. A great leaping tongue of fire licks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, just as destruction seems imminent, the capsule miraculously changes its flight path and soars above the remaining flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It races through them. A shadow passes over MONGO as the CAPSULE passes through a wall of PURPLE VAPOR and emerges above a totally different landscape. A dozen VARIOUS COLO CLOUDS sweep past in silent majesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAPSULE slows, hovers starts straight down into a sea high grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distant B.G. against an extraordinary SUNSET SKY, rises the shimmering CITY OF MONGO.... a place of many le golden tiers and turrets, towers, flags and pennants. It like something dreamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several STRANGELY ARMORED MEN watch the MIRROR-BRIGHT CAP descending slowly. The LEADER waves and they all start to the CAPSULE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentle bump as the thing touches down. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By God, we did it! We made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made it where, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly DALE gasps, reacting to something she SEES throu the transparent-from-within wall. They all look around an SEE those STRANGE MEN approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. Suddenly I like it in here just fine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ARMORED MEN, FLASH, LEADER, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of the CAPSULE is opened from the inside. ZARKOV and DALE and FLASH get out. THE MEN stop. Long beat as th two parties gaze at each other, the first human eye ever see an extraterrestrial being. FLASH walks up to the lead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello -- my name's Flash Gordon -- can you understand me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're from EARTH -- we come as friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extend your hand! That's the gesture of friendship known everywhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a warm grin, FLASH extends hi right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLACK! With lightning speed a manacle is slammed on FLASH wrist and he is thrown to В·the ground as other RED MEN a to handcuff DALE and ZARKOV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are prisoners. I will take you now to Ming the Merciless, Ruler of the universe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail, Ming! 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groggily, FLASH lifts his head towards ZARKOV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Doctor -- next time I'll call my own play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another strange glimpse through an opening. Some fierce tethered BEAST is being goaded and tormented by MONGO MEN as in an Elizabethan bear-baiting. On the floor lies the tor n body of one MAN who apparently got too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE has one brief horrified GLIMPSE of this, then turns head away and shuts her eyes as she's marched along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do what I'm doing. Flash --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutting my eyes -- dreaming I booked us to Disneyland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gigantic STATUE comes into view amidst topless columns the end. Light plays over it in ever-shifting patterns. A we come nearer, we SEE that this STATUE is cut out in the middle to form a throne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING THE MERCILESS sits in the throne niche, silent, gazi down on the PRISONERS as they are marched to a halt befor him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail, Ming! Hail, Great One Without Mercy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred reduplicated ECHOES of that shout ring through unseen reaches of the palace. MING bends his head slightl in acknowledgement, points idly at the ARMORED MEN at the left of the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As FLASH, DALE and ZARKOV are marched along by many ARMOR MEN, perspectives are bewildering, curvilinear, surfaces 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bending away into caverns of gloom without measurable dimension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pass an archway opening into what seems to be an AMUSE NT ARCADE. Glimpse of MONGO PEOPLE playing amazing electr games, while MONGO GO-GO GIRLS cavort on a platform to unearthly music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic -- into a Black Hole and out the other side -- to this. Who said Hans Zarkov was mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look down over a balcony from a MOVING POV. A fencing gla is in session. SIX PAIRS OF MEN go at each other with mag swords which give off pyrotechnical displays each time th blades clash. Thrust, parry, SLASH! The head of one duell EXPLODES in a bloodless fountain of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got us into this -- HOW DO WE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out? Why? We're being taken to Ming -- getting at him is our only hope of saving EARTH. It's perfect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Zarkov, I'm about to show you what it feels like to be clipped by a New York Giant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash, it's no use - he's too crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step forward, Soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The designated one marches two paces forward, halts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you loyal to Ming? Would you die for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall on your sword. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly the ARMORED MAN pulls his sword, rips open his breast-plate, sets the sword hilt-down on the floor and PLUNGES FORWARD on to the fatal point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a little cry of horror, DALE shrinks back into FLASH arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You inhuman fiend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm "inhuman"! -- that's a compliment! (Dropping his voice) Pathetic Earthlings, forever wondering if you are alone in the universe -- beaming you plaintive messages into to the void for anything that might hear you -- even hurling your bodies out into it -- and all without the faintest inkling of who or what is out here. If you had known anything -- anything at all about the true nature of the universe, you would have hidden from it, in terror!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a low throaty LAUGH from the shadows. FLASH and DALE turn their eyes quickly in its direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emerging half into the light beside a column, fondling th head of an obscure BEAST slouching between her legs. Voluptuous beyond her years, fiercely erotic, AURA looks FLASH boldly up and down as the BEAST HISSES with the ple of her touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH can't take his eyes off her. No normal man could. F swallows with a dry throat as AURA'S gaze devours him. DA gets the electricity going on, gives him a poke and WHISP LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it, fella -- you came with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA laughs again, sidles up toward MING. We dimly SEE a couple of MUTANT CREATURES dragging away the lifeless bod of the one who so vividly proved his loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who Ming is now -- who are you and why do you come to Mongo? 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Flash Gordon of the New York Giants this is Dale Arden -- Dr.Zarkov hijacked us in an effort to save EARTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING looks questioningly at KLYTUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirs, Earth is the meaningless planet you are in the process of obliterating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouncing on that) In the process? You mean Earth still exists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the moment -- not for much longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why? What in hell have we ever done to hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You exist -- and yet you pay no homage to Ming! What greater crime can be committed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The palace rings with an answering chorus: VOICES of all ARMORED MEN and numerous others presently UNSEEN, includi many WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail, Ming! Hail, Great One Without Mercy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come closer, Dale Arden -- let me see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE doesn't move. MING takes a step down, narrows his ey and gazes at her intensely. This guy's personal magnetism is enormous. As if irresistibly drawn, DALE steps forward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING moves his hand in a gesture. A sourceless GOLDEN LIG bathes DALE, sensuous MUSICAL CHORDS are heard. DALE's li open slightly, her color heightens, her rate of breathing increases. MING touches her flesh lightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH tense, ready to spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This woman will amuse you. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klytus can see the future, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can foresee it -- but for a few moments only. It gives him a unique gift for survival, -- and treachery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extraordinary. I'd like to study his beta factors -- I wager I could extend them with a course of telekinetic exercise. (peering at KLYTUS) Tell me -- when you use this fit does your temporal lobe prickle? Here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING flashes a glance of interest at ZARKOV, then address the LEADER of the ARMORED MEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chain this one up. Preserve him for further examination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail, Ming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV is roughly seized. FLASH starts after them angrily as they drag the scientist away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no you don't! We came together and we're STAYING together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Languidly, MING indicates FLASH GORDON with a pointed fin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one is useless to us. Remove him and kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shock reactions. FLASH wheels back at MING as DALE steps front of her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dirty old bastard can kill me too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wetting her lips, moving sinuously to WHISPER to MING: 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kill him yet, Father. Give him to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would your Prince Barin say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle Barin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Aura -- your appetites are too monstrous -- even for our family. This could cause great trouble with Barin -- I must forbid it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA touches the rime of MING'S ear with her tongue as sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you adore me, Father -- you ca refuse me nothing . Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As MING steps quickly away from his super-provocative dau and indicates DALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the Earth-woman to our quarters! Bathe and annoint her for our pleasure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOODED GUARD comes from shadow, moves towards DALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH starts around to defend her, but before he can do i DALE has made her own move. WHAM! Quick as lightning, she flattened the HOODED GUARD with a perfectly executed city girl's kick to the balls. DALE is astonished at her own prowess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God -- and I thought that book was another rip-off-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out! Behind you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three more HOODED GUARDS are emerging from the shadows to DALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH flies at them. An elbow in the mouth disposes of on He seizes the man's mace-like club as he falls, uses it quickly to knock cold the other two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA'S eyes shine at FLASH'S prowess. Fascinated, she run her moist tongue along the cutting edge of her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panting, braced, FLASH stands in front of DALE with raise mace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unearthly MARTIAL MUSIC comes in a glissando from the Cavernous space above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To its tempo MING'S PERSONAL GUARDS now startsВ· appearin They are all a race of AMAZON WARRIORS, and the most amaz thing is that they all have the SAME FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From left to right, back and front, the AMAZONS advance 0 FLASH and DALE. They do not attack, merely stun ad overwh us with their massive, silent, answerable threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH swallows, looks this way and that, stands as if paralysed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low and tremulous) What's the play, Flash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't -- I just can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clobber a woman, Dale --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You damn fool, those aren't women they're murderous AMAZON DYKES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AMAZONS are all around DALE now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH is paralyzed by indecision one beat more, then sudd makes up his mind. He flies into action, SLAMS the neares pair of AMAZONS. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast and furious. Great havoc is wreaked by DALE and her karate, by FLASH and his flailing fists, but the AMAZONS' numerical superiority is of course decisive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon FLASH is on the floor, pinioned by a dozen AMAZONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up, with despairing eyes SEES poor DALE being dr up a flight of stairs that disappear mysteriously into up gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pitiful shout sends FLASH'S adrenaline rushing. With superhuman effort, he fights free from the pile-up and da after DALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH struggles to get through to DALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE claws fiercely at the bare AMAZON arms and shoulders that engulf her, reaches desperately back down for FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just touching their fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens like a yawning trap door UNDER FLASH'S FEET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH drops away with a YELL, in the very instant that AU comes running INTO THE SHOT and boldly JUMPS after him. AURA is swallowed up too, a split-second before the trap door step CLOSES again after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (KLYTUS, MING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching that, as KLYTUS hisses into his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She betrays you! She'll take him to Aboria!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Prince Barin will kill Flash Gordon for me -- I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be too sure! 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING glances at him, then back up the stairs at where DAL has vanished. His face softens, his tone turns museful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't taken a wife in centuries. I could bring myself to marry this Dale Arden --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see in her future, Klytus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO reply. MING turns his head and finds that KLYTUS is go Vanished. Not particularly surprised or concerned, MING g again toward the top of the stairs and answers his own question with a licentious smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is seemingly endless, faintly lt by phosphoresence fro below. We dimly make out the figures of FLASH and AURA fa away from us, far below, falling, falling. We HEAR Hollow echoing VOICES reverbrating up to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a deep breath! Grab my ankle after we hit the water -- I'll lead you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit what water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In answer, we instantly HEAR a titanic SPLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH plummets down, AURA right after him. Recovering bal in a universe of bubbles, FLASH finds himself confronting enormous savage LUMINOUS FISH. Wheeling himself away in fear and revulsion, FLASH encounters AURA. He seizes her ankle as directed. Holding his beat, FLASH swims after he through a maze of stalagmites growing up from the cavern floor. AURA dives down, leads him OUT OF SIGHT through a opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, FLASH, PLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and AURA emerge from a pool of water. FLASH stagger across and collapses on a fringe of beach. For sure, AURA wet clinging robe doesn't make her look any less sexy. He stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch your breath -- then I'll take you up and find you a disguise. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saving my life. How can I Thank you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll fly you to the forest of Arboria - we'll find a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get one thing straight -- I've got to find Dale and that nut Zarkov too -- rescue them and try to save Earth too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize how foolish you are to tell that to me -- Ming's daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no good at lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're funny -- are all Eathlings like you, Flash Gordon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm about average.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are windows on one side, emitting a fierce GLARE. F follows AURA rapidly along. Suddenly he stops short, look in through the tinted glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An infernal place, chief feature of which is a LAKE OF SEETHING MAGMA that slowly rotates within a wide encircli platform. The platform is piled with GLOWING RADIOACTIVE GRAVEL, being shoveled into the magma by LIZARDMAN SLAVES who toil in rythmic unison.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: AURA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The plasma core. It's e source of the energy-beam my father ia aiming at Earth. You can't stop it. Ming is merciless and all-powerful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing ankle electrodes shackled to each SLAVE, so that those who collapse can be shocked back to their feet by G stationed on a surrounding catwalk above. Any SLAVE unabl to rise is summarily pitched into the magma by HOODED MEN waiting like executioners to perform this chore.

dialogues.speaker: AURA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The slaves are Lizard Men. Once they had their own water Kingdom, the fairest of Mongo. Then they dared to rebel. They will suffer for it here forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH looks at AURA again, then back in the window. He reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV is being led along by SOLDIERS, heavily shackled. stops, gazing in wonder at the seething lake, which FLARE UP BLINDINGLY with each shovel full of gravel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and AURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't reach him. If a soldier spots you, it's instant death! -- Come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA takes his hand. With one backward look toward ZARKOV who of course has not seen him, FLASH follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MING'S VOICE, SOLDIER, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible - the very core of this planet, is it not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are but soldiers. We do not know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guess well, Dr. Zarkov!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV wheels in his chains, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EVERYONE, MING, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High above this place where MING stands with KLYTUS, lit the infernal glare as he goes on: 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am forcing this plasma through the successive nuclear phases of a star - building it toward the apocalyptic moment that will end Earth's pathetic history in one flash of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devil! Why don't you turn this science to peaceful use? The name Ming would be blessed instead of cursed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him up to the dome, Soldiers -- we wish to show him wonders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that instant a couple of worn-out SLAVES are pitched i the magma. Their dying SCREAMS are drowned by the chorus from all the minions:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail! Ming! Hail, Great one Without Mercy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA leads FLASH out through a doorway. He is now fitted with a fairly resplendent MONGO costume: boots, cape, headdress and all. They hurry along through shadows. Sudd FLASH seizes her by the shoulders, stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, where's he got Dale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she looks at him, she SEES a detachment of SOLDIERS marching this direction. Quickly she pulls FLASH into a n presses her body against his in the narrow space. WHISPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget Dale Arden!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't! I mean I hardly know her,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget her, Flash Gordon: I saw a look in my father's eye -- I think he intends to marry her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?? Marry her? What are you talking about?? 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOLDIERS have gone past, but AURA is still pressing against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you ask so many questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you to people who'll help you. Trust me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I honestly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA hauls FLASH from the niche, they hurry on a bit furt AURA stops in front of big doors, with glass windows in t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've dressed you as a Royal Pilot, First Class. We'll slip into my personal car and you'll fly it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH takes one look into the glass, then swivels back to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are ROCKET SHIPS in there! I can't fly a damn rocket ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft, teasing) Learn from me -- I'll teach you so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MING, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open at the top to space. But instead of our familiar pin stars, here whole nebulae wheel in majesty against infini their innards popping with explosions as whole galaxies a born and die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV stands before MING in chains, mesmerized by fantas devices on every side. Most prominent is a huge transpare cube, supported in the air above a control console. MING moves to that, plays in it like an organist. we HEAR a so intense hum, GLIMPSE great dish-like radio antennae turni on the top side of the dome. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An astonishing things happens. Inside the cube a recognis greenish globe appears like a three-dimensional holograph slowly turning as the continents and oceans come into vie below a veil of clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Zarkov -- as it was. Now as it will be, when my plasma reaches full force.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden TIDE OF FIRE sweeps the globe, Even the clouds B ZARKOV gasps as MING'S fingers dance of the control keys again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as it will be in yet another time, long after you have died. Earth reborn! A pleasant image, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fires recede. The hanging globe sparkles again with b just as it was except that the outlines of our continents have been subtly changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's impossible! Even your perverted genius can't create new life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I can create life. There's nothing easier. It only requires myself and one woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale Arden.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else? As in that childish myth of yours -- Adam and Eve, wasn't it? I will breed with her and repopulate the Earth in my own image. I've already done it on over a thousand planets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING touches a key. The image of Earth DISAPPEARS from th cube. ZARKOV glares hatred at MING for a beat, then his e catches something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big block of crystal on the floor with two swords embed in it, just their hilts sticking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE to include ZARKOV. Chained as he is, he suddenly bo over and seizes a sword hilt, tries to pull it out. It do budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The magic blades are not for your kind, Zarkov. One is my own the other will only be withdrawn by my rightful heir. Pull on them with all your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV tugs desperately, but it doesn't give an inch. He falls panting over the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING laughs, makes a sign to a SOLDIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return him to the dungeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, HEDONIA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE stands amongst the EXOTIC FEMALES of this lavish pla being gently but firmly divested of her clothes and put i a diaphanous gown. They intend her no harm. Though each h some slight unearthly peculiarity, all are very beautiful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tickled, DALE can't suppress a giggle. The females are am and delighted by this phenomenon. They take turns poking her ribs as tall HEDONIA glides up, bearing a flagon of g liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE recoils, her giggling cut short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it -- some rotten drug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has no name. But many brave men died to bring it across space from Cythera, planet of Pleasure. It will make your hours with Ming more agreeable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a karate chop, DALE- knocks the flagon away. HEDONIA rubs her hurt wrist but does not seem angry. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are of different race, Dale Arden but we all are women here. I know your fears. Believe me, it will be better if you drink it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEDONIA retrieves the flagon from the silken pillow where landed, extends it again to DALE. A shout!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash! Where are you??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course there is no answer. Sudden tears of despair spr from DALE'S eyes. She seizes the flagon and impulsively d it. Her expression changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, this stuff isn't bad at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sails along, a wonderful little bubble-topped two-seater, with royal devices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floats toward us, dazzling sphere of frozen seas and glac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming into SHOT in a curving pass over the surface. It's Nifty bubble-top two-seater with royal devices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no normal controls, just a glowing multi-colore panel over which the pilot makes hand-movements to effect changes of course and attitude. FLASH is in the left-hand seat beside AURA, gazing down at the glittering sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frigia -- eleventh of the moons of Mongo. It's inhabited by the Bear Men who eat their own young...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH shivers. Patches of frost and ice start to form on the craft's bubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now pull up -- go starboard around that next moon rising -- Ardentia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH moves his hands over the panel. The craft pulls up and banks. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another moon RISING ahead. Its reddish desert surface is swept by a raging sandstorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some lucky people live on that one too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course - the Sand Men. Every Moon is a kingdom -- seperate and hostile to all the others. They have nothing in common but Ming's rule -- and their hatred of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't they team up and fight him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight Ming the Merciless?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw what happened to the Lizard Men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sudden thoughtful look, his head working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue -- but that wasn't a team effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know these words what's a "team"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH just shakes his head. AURA watches him a beat more, then reaches up and pulls down a curious gadget hanging a her seat. It's a TRANSPARENT HOOD with strange fittings inside, not totally unlike a beauty-shop hairdryer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telekinetic Thought Transfer. (setting its dials) I'm going to get together with Prince Barin in Arboria and tell him I'm arriving. He's the one who'll help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he does anything I ask. He loves me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can really transfer your thoughts with that? Like I could get in touch with Dale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I showed you how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not going to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA just gives him a look and laughs. FLASH stares at he moment, then suddenly MOVES HIS HANDS sharply over the co panel. The craft hurtles into a violent DIVE. AURA yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA drops the plastic hood, lunges to move. her own hand on the controls, but FLASH seizes her wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing the windblown surface of the moon ARDENTIA dead a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you mad> We're diving straight at Ardentia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Princess В·В·В· and we're not pulling out until you put that gadget over my head and tune me in to Dale Arden!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA struggles wildly, but FLASH'S grip on her wrists is like iron. The surface of Ardentia LOOMS UP , closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH'S VOICE, HEDONIA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE is immersed naked in a bubbly swirling tub, a luxuri prisoner of the FEMALES who bathe and groom her. She seem dazed by steam and by the sensuous movement of the water. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of the FEMALES lift DALE'S hands, make a cup of them. HEDONIA pours rich oil into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rub this on your body. It gives Ming pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE starts to oil herself as the FEMALES exchange looks LAUGH softly. Suddenly a FILTERED VOICE is HEARD from now though it seems very close:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, it's me -- Flash! Am I with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blinks, befuddled, pauses in her oiling of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the Thought Transference gizmo down over his head, a faint BLUISH GLOW flickering within, as AURA watches him we SEE the moon Ardentia falling behind rapidly through t glass. FLASH concentrates fiercely. We HEAR his VOICED THOUGHTS but his lips do not move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dale -- you're not dreaming I'm Flash -- I'm with you and you are with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE'S VOICE, FLASH'S VOICE, FLASH' S VOICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you receiving my thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we HEAR DALE'S VOICE, without her lips moving either:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm receiving something -- 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read you, Dale -- I'm getting you too! Think of me -- hard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they communicate. NOTE: There might be some faint glow in the air above the tub some spectral suggestion. of FLA presence, the idea being to show that HEDONIA and other FEMALES are unaware of this interchange going on as they continue to bathe and groom DALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE'S VOICE, FLASH'S VOICE, FLASH' S VOICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you Flash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speeding for the Kingdom of Arboria to get help! I'm in a spacecraft with Aura, Ming's daughter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That bitch? Don't trust her! She's after you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, she means nothing to me -- not a darn thing. Where are you, Dale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naked in a bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God -- if I could only see you, Dale. If I could touch you -- what are you in a tub for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being fixed up for Ming.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH' S VOICE
dialogues.text: No! Where's Dr. Zarkov?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chained in a dungeon, I think. What'll I do, Flash?

dialogues.speaker: FLASH' S VOICE
dialogues.text: Fake 'em out! 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fake 'em out, Dale -- girls know how. But don't go too far. I mean get to Zarkov and release him, I'll have help by then -- I'll find you. Can you do all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like fourth down and about ninety yards to go, but I'll try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, you're some girl -- God, you really are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you get what I'm thinking now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH' S VOICE
dialogues.text: Dale, we're gonna get out of this jam -- I swear we will -- I'll find you, and when I do we'll -----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who has been watching FLASH'S face with increasing frustr and jealousy during this, Suddenly snatching the Thought Transfer bubble OFF FLASH'S head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a dazed dreamy look on his face. AURA slaps him ou of it, points-ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Arboria!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green tangle of branches and leaves and vines. ANGLING UP we SEE the SHUTTLE CRAFT approaching us head-on at a down angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It races up toward the craft's windshield. We level off f a moment, then PLUNGE DOWN again into a blur of green. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working his hands over the control sensors as crazy GREEN rushes by outside. THUMP THUD CRASH! The craft careens to swinging HALT, so Suddenly that FLASH and AURA almost hav their wind knocked out as they are thrown against their s belts. FLASH recovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I guess landings aren't my thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hangs snagged in a huge vine, like a creature caught b some monstrous boa-constrictor. This is a complete world green, the light, the feeling of the air. Everything ring with forest SOUNDS. The very sky is shut from view by lea and foliage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The craft's hatch opens. FLASH struggles out, gives AURA hand up. Kneeling on the cabin, FLASH takes in this incre vista stretching all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Robin Hood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. How do we get down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carefully, balancing lithely, AURA starts along the trunk the great vine that caught them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, SERVING GIRL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ultra-Byzantine splendor. The only light is by a huge bed on which DALE reclines. A SERVING GIRL glides up with a flagon of that liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is coming to see you now. Are you ready? 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (easy, smiling) Very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need any more of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks. Just turn down the light a bit, would you? I'm shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SERVING GIRL leans over the bed to do so. We GLIMPSE DALE'S HAND rising quickly to deliver a karate-chop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING walks down it toward a closed door at the end. He pa a moment in anticipation, composes himself, opens the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nearly dark. MING comes from shadows, looks down at bed. There is a feminine silhouette on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING sits, extends a hand. His FINGERS travel sensuously a BARE THIGH, suddenly stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Savagely, MING pulls the face of the GIRL into the light. is not DALE ARDEN but the unconscious SERVING GIRL, now dressed in DALE'S gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPENING CLOSE on ZARKOV, who lies asleep in his chains. A hand touches his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV wakes with a start to SEE a SERVING GIRL bending o him, tray in hand. She moves her cloak to reveal that she DALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD stands nearby against a wall, faceless in the sha of a cowled uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serving Girl - what business have you in this dungeon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE quickly puts the tray down, stands and turns to the GUARD She smiles invitingly, lifts her skirt up above her knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The legs are long and terrific. 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUARD catches his breath, steps toward her lecherousl to accept the invitation. WHAM! He doubles up as DALE kic him in the groin, goes down without a sound as a left-rig left series of KARATE CHOPS hits his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is hardly on the floor before DALE is pouncing on the ring at his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making their way swiftly through it between earth and hea crossing this green world on branches and trunks of monst vines. FLASH pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen -- are you sure this Barin will help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gently, provocatively, AURA puts her finger on his lips t silence him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssssh...... Trust me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of a fantastic structure, many levels, built of wood and other materials from the heart of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE OFF it to find FLASH and AURA nearby, him gazing at this apparition with a strange wistful expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing -- I dreamed of this tree-house when I was a kid --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA laughs softly, waves him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: climbing the ramp-like stairs which wind up around it in mounting spiral. SUddenly the forest rings with SINGSONG CRIES and CALLS I mingled with a sort of ROARING SNARL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Barin's hunt! Watch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA leads him on at a run to the wide balcony above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a desperate LION MAN, running full tilt; roaring and snarling as he zig-zags this way and that. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a SWISHING SOUND and an arrow-like missile catch him in the back. Sharp PFSSSSS: as of gas escaping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ALL THREE MEN, TREE MAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN, PRINCE OF ARBORIA and looking every inch the part, stands with a fired crossbow. Over his shoulder is a quiv of GLASS ARROWS, each a little POINTED CYLINDER at the en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some distance behind and around we see a number of his lo TREE MEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barin got him!

dialogues.speaker: ALL THREE MEN
dialogues.text: Hail, Ming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH'S eyes jumping to her as he hears that echoing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the guys who are gonna help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means nothing. They only shout that because it's treason not to. They hate Ming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I scent a Tiger Man near the lodge! Form battle lines above and below!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the TREE MEN scurry to obey, BARIN moves forward, relo and cocking his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stricken LION MAN comes INTO VIEW. Incredibly, the gl arrow in his back has transformed him into a STATUE OF IC At BARIN'S footfall, he DISINTEGRATES in a tinkling fall frozen shards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TIGER MAN is poised behind a tree near the lodge, pan He is a magnificent creature, with a horn sticking out of his forehead. He tenses, HEARING the BIRDLIKE CALLS of th advancing hunters. Closer, closer. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE WIDENS. We SEE another PAIR OF LION MEN crouching nearby, terrified. The line of TREE MEN comes INTO VIEW. crouching pair look in appeal to the TIGER MAN by the tre He watches a beat, waves them to run backward, then cover the escape of the others, TIGER MAN charges into his enem headlong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and AURA watch the fight. TIGER MAN'S rage is magnificent as he flails the nearest TREE MEN without reg for their number. He has flattened half a dozen when sudd BARIN'S upper line of TREE MEN leap DOWN on him from the branches above, and he is buried under their sheer weight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know just how he feels -- we played the Pittsburgh Steelers last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, TREE MAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE - BARIN advancing by himself, HEARING the triumphan SHOUTS of his men.

dialogues.speaker: TREE MAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Prince Barin! We have him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not him! Bring him back for sport:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching with horrified fascination as NETS are thrown ov the struggling TIGER MAN. AURA'S eyes bright with lust fo this kind of spectacle, AURA speaks low to FLASH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go inside -- let me talk to Barin first. (as FLASH hesitates) Foolish Earthling - trust me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, BARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN walks up ahead of some TREE MEN who are carrying th TIGER MAN in their nets. Suddenly he stops, reacting to AURA on the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aura! 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so long since I've been with you, Barin -- I couldn't stand it. Please don't be too angry at me for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, BARIN, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH is flattened against the wall, IWATCHING through lo of a door. SOUND of feet on ramp, SNARLING and ROARING of captive TIGER MAN. BARIN comes hastening INTO VIEW on the balcony and embraces AURA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll stay the night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've dreamed of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes alight with anticipation, BARIN steps back from her. as his MEN arrive with the netted TIGER MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a sword -- (turning to AURA) This is the fiercest Tiger Man we have ever hunted. I'm going to kill him now -- and dedicate his blood to you, my beloved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's treason! Blood can be dedicated to Ming alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you, Aura -- the more a man risks, the greater your passion. If I knew a greater risk, I'd take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA SMILES, turns and calls softly toward the interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash Gordon -- come out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH steps out, halts about ten feet from BARIN. Reactio from BARIN and his TREE MEN. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from Earth, Prince Barin. My friends and I were Ming's prisoners. She kindly brought me here to enlist your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in hell? My help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hide him from my father -- don't let him wander -- keep him for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep me for.....????

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my god. I trusted you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA darts INTO SHOT, puts her lips to his ear and WHISPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still must -- I'm playing a game!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA darts back into shot on his side now, WHISPERS in sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a mere toy to me, my love -- when I'm tired of it we'll kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as AURA quickly steps away, continues aloud:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the risk I ask, Barin hide him for me in Arboria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll hide him, all right -- under six feet of Arborian dirt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sword BARIN ordered has been brought. He seizes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not your enemy, Prince Barin. we share a hatred of Ming 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you so afraid of my Earthling, Barin; Won't you even give him a chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN hesitates, provoked by that, then shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snake keeper! Rouse your beast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HALFWIT TREE MAN, drowsing against another part of the parapet, He jerks awake, shuffles across to a big wicker basket, pulls off the lid. A hideous EEL-LIKE SERPANT rea it's head, HISSING and SNAPPING venemously. The KEEPER st his arm down. The snake coils around it. With a drooling grin, the KEEPER withdraws it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU FLASH watching with horrified revulsion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEEPER carries the hissing snapping snake toward an enorm STUMP of a tree trunk. He holds his arm out over it, WHIS a curious note. The snake leaps off the arm and VANISHES into the hollowed out trunk. We notice now that there are SIX HOLES drilled into the gnarled wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who dares the beast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battle-scarred OLD TREE MAN steps forward. without a wo he goes to the stump and plunges a hand INTO one of the h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG CU SNAKE with a hiss, fangs strike a wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, BARIN, FLASH, TREE MEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With eyes widening in horror, hs face starts to turn BLUE He pulls out his hand and staggers backward. BARIN plunge his sword into the man's breast and he topples over the parapet, dead. Sword in hand, BARIN turns to FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did him a mercy. This venom brings death only after long tortured madness. Your turn, Earthling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll pass on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are six openings to the serpent. Five are safe -- the sixth is death. Choose one -- or take your end from my sword here and now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swallows, Looks at the stump, at BARIN with his bloody sword, to the stump again, then at AURA. He crosses close and stares into her glittering eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you give Dale a message from me? Tell her I'm sorry how things have panned out -- I Loved her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? Forget it. Sending that message by you is like sending a lettuce-leaf by a rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN'S sword touches FLASH'S back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to the stump. Every eye is on him, every breath held.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sudden quick motion, FLASH plunges his hand into a hole. He leaves it there a second, then whips it back out and wheels to BARIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew! -- Your turn, Prince Barin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN goes still. This is not what he had planned. AURA'S Tongue runs over her tee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your love for me is great enough, Barin, surely it will protect you from the serpent -- no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA laughs softly. BARIN strides across, plunges his han into another hole, rips it out again unscathed. He whirls FLASH, points the sword at him. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH thrusts into a third hole, pulls out again. Turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN glares at him, takes a breath, jams his hand into t fourth of the six holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes widen horribly, he makes a choked sound. PULL BA FAST as he whips his hand out, unbitten. His face twists into a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fooled you, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA laughs, turns her smile on FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an even chance now, Flash Gordon -- that's better than Daddy would have given you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy. You oughta be handled with a forked stick yourself.
