dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were you, I'd choose the sword --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point touches FLASH again. Just two holes left. He do a silently mouthed eeny-meeny-miney-mo between them, plun his hand into one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snake's head MOVES fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wincing, contorting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As FLASH whips his arm out again. Amazingly, he has hold the terrible serpent, grasping it just below the head. CR from the astounded TREE MEN, and then FLASH is leaping IN ACTION. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whirling, FLASH swings the hissing snapping writhing beas at the nearest TREEMEN, scattering them, and thrusts the serpent's head at BARIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN slashes with his sword, misses. The serpent's tail coils around the blade, rips it from BARIN'S hand as the Prince of Arboria dives backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH whirls again, SLAMS the serpent's head into a post, and SNATCHES the sword from the tail before it hits the f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dashes for the ramp to the ground.. The TIGER MAN is r in front of him, struggling in the net. FLASH pauses, SLA at the cords. TIGER MAN is freed, bounds to his feet with ROAR, clobbers a pair of TREE MEN just jumping on him and FLASH. Snatching one's CROSSBOW and QUIVER OF GLASS ARROW he races down the ramp behind FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picking himself up, wheeling furiously on AURA, who has b watching all this with her lips half parted, her tongue flicking teeth in supersensuous excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mere toy of yours, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I was wrong -- surely the Prince of Arboria wouldn't be beaten by a toy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN snatches a horn from his belt, blows a BLAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hunt's on, my Tree Men!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the hunt with Barin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FLASH, TIGER MAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run through the green tangle. FLASH trips over a vin TIGER MAN picks him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for freeing me. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can speak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all the good it does me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUNDS echo: hunting horns, birdcalls of TREE MEN. They s running again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we a chance, Tiger Man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if we climb -- out of the green light -- to the sky -- Prince Barin's Tree Men can't follow us up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ming's Law -- outside his own kingdom, every hunter becomes the hunted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead is a huge tree made for climbing: branches stick ou like the rungs of some great green ladder. They leap onto the lowest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLES - THE TREE - FLASH and TIGER MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climbing. Jack and the Beanstalk, up and up, panting, but there is never a top in sight. Suddenly the branches end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. End of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGER MAN reacts to something off. Touches FLASH'S should and points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crazy sort of ELEVATOR is going by. It's a moving. vine with LEAFY BASKETS attached, a vertical conveyor from the ground to above. As FLASH and TIGER MAN watch, they SEE o basket moving UP with an armed TREE MAN in it, scanning t forest below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatches the crossbow off TIGER MAN'S back, cocks it, not it quickly with a GLASS ARROW from the quiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hearing the CLICK of the cocking. He wheels, looks up, SE FLASH. Letting out a fierce BIRDCALL. he jumps up and swi his own crossbow just as FLASH shoots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWISH-PFFST as FLASH'S arrow hits him. ICE, he tumbles ou of the basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and TIGER MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run out along the branch, jump INTO the basket as it pass by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far will this take us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know --no man has ever been above the green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, FLASH, TREE MAN, TIGER MAN, TREE MAN LEADER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN and a troop of TREE MEN are poised in the branches, listening acutely. The one scouting in front calls back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sight -- call came from the left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TREE MA.i. The sight-call carne from the left:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up and across we'll cut them off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He BLOWS his horn again. The TREE MEN start moving quickl some climbing, others SWINGING laterally on vines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and TIGER MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rising looking upward, as the light through the leaves is changing, becoming less intensely green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that color above?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue. We call is blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOZEN TREE MEN come swinging into view on vines, land o fat branch. The LEADER looks right in this direction, poi and gives a chilling BIRDCALL. The TREE MEN unsling their crossbows, reach for GLASS ARROWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and TIGER MAN 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEEING cold death staring them in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH reaches for an arrow, notches it.

dialogues.speaker: TREE MAN LEADER
dialogues.text: You haven't a chance! Throw down your weapon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH makes like to throw his crossbow away. At the last instant, h swings it around, aims and FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are startled as the arrow WHIRRS in and sticks into the b under their feet. The branch instantly turns to ICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEARS a loud brittle CRACKING SOUND. He looks up, gapes, holds on tight to the tree trunk. A dozen SHRIEKING TREE plummet down around him amidst chunks of ICE, crashing th the branches to doom. A look of fierce delight on his fac BARIN resumes his climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FLASH, TIGER MAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and TIGER MAN jump from their basket into a wide le near a loading platform where the elevator-vine goes arou a great iron wheel. The forest is open to the sky at this altitude, a sunny Eden of huge exotic flowers. Enormous overlapping leaves form a floor FLASH and TIGER MAN can s on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way to the border:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legend says Arboria ends in an ocean to the west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH quickly checks his wristwatch and the angle of the shadows, starts in the direction he estimates is west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and TIGER MAN running over the leaves, which are somewhat BOUNCY like a huge trampoline. It's quite enjoya FLASH laughs aloud at the sensation, takes a big jump off the edge of one leaf, BOUNCES HIGH from the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazingly, a fat TENDRIL seizes him in mid-air, coils aro his waist. FLASH yells as he is lifted further up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is right above him. The closed petals open. The inside is viscous, hideous looking. In the deepest recess is a dark red blob which PULSES like a huge heart, emits a BEING SO With horror, FLASH realizes the tendril is feeding him in the flower's maw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLASH struggles vainly against the tendril's strength. TI MAN dashes to his rescue below, but another tendril knock him flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, FLASH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH is conveyed INTO the flower. He punches wildly with his fists, kicks, but petals are CLOSING inexorably aroun him. On their inner surface are deadly spiny SPIKES. Scattered around are the crushed SKELETONS of luckless TR MEN who have been fed in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWISH-PFFFFST! Out of nowhere a GLASS ARROW comes flying past FLASH'S ear, sinks itself into the flower's heart. T flower SHRIEKS. All around, FLASH, it is turning into crystalline ICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tendrils lose their grip, FLASH falls onto the leaf b beside the TIGER MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As FLASH turns his head to see BARIN standing with his crossbow on a leaf some twenty feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saved you because your death must be mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point of all this killing? Why don't we team up and overthrow Ming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN notches another arrow, cocks his bow, with slow ple raises it and aims at FLASH'S heart. Suddenly a SHADOW co BARIN. He jerks his head up to SEE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diving from the sun at him. It is a HAWKMAN, magnificient fierce. It seizes BARIN in its talons and lifts him INTO AIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hover, their wings beating the air. They dive on FLASH an TIGER MAN, lift them too. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rises in a steep climb over Arboria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the pilot's seat gazes OFF at something through tricky little binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ascending with their three captives-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the binoculars down, with one hand lowers the THOUGHT TRANSFER hood over her head, with the other waves the cra into a sharp turn away from the HAWKMEN. Without her lips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Princess Aura returns to Mingo City The passage through the force-field opens at her approach --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA twists the tuning dial, then goes on in a soft

dialogues.speaker: AURA'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daddy darling -- am I with you? Are you getting me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sits some fanciful form of ground transport: perhaps a th with bicycle wheels and sails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are inside, she watching tensely as ZARKQV throws switches and eyes displays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basic circuits seem okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has-to fly! We gotta rescue FLASH from that vampire before she --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudden BLINDING BLUE LIGHT explodes within the capsule. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come diving out headlong into the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaven knows. I was just starting to test the primary transformer-banks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV stops abruptly, looking down at himself. DALE gasp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God -- your hands! Your hands are gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is true: ZARKOV has no hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not gone -- Just invisible. See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INVISIBLE HANDS pick up a pebble from the ground, hold it before DALE'S nose. Magically, they toss the little objec back and forth from one UNSEEN HAND to the other. DALE to one, can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bit. I believe Mongo's gravitational. field must have reversed the polarity of my generator so that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks off again. Slowly, in front of our eyes, ZARKOV HANDS are FADING IN, again and becoming VISIBLE. DALE whi in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neat trick. I wonder if it's controllable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHADOW over them suddenly. Great WHIRRING of wings. DALE Looks up and SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swoop down on ZARKOV and DALE, bear them aloft as they di with FLASH AND TIGER MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (KLYTUS, MING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his wonderous DOME ROOM, watching something. PULL BACK KLYTUS is beside him as usual. ANGLE to include the VIEWI SCREEN which MING is watching. On it is a directional continuation of the scene we just saw: a struggling DALE being Carrie dup into the open sky by HAWKMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mongo is restless today. Your vessels stray from their appointed kingdoms....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That damned Vultan -- time I clipped his wings once and for all. We could put those insolent Hawkmen of his to work in the plasma cavern ----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale Arden and Flash Gordon? Will I send out the Imperial Fleet to bring them back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll let Vultan tame her first -- I'll look pretty to Dale Arden after him. Flash Gordon is nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLYTUS smiles that sinister way. MING looks at him questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sire, it is not for me to tell Great, Ming that he is making mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (HAWKMAN, TIGER MAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serried squadrons of HAWKMEN escort the ones bearing FLAS BARIN and TIGER MAN through space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling against the TWO HAWKMEN who have him, snarling and roaring. He butts one in the belly with his horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want us to let you go, et? 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light streams rough tremendous El Greco clouds. HAWKMEN A tiny figures, rising against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Higher, higher. Above the clouds a blinding DAZZLE comes INTO FRAME. It resolves into a fantastic SKY PALACE hangi in mid-air, reflecting sunlight from myriad turrets and terraces. The HAWKMEN climb above it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying FLASH and BARIN and TIGER MAN , going into a screaming dive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rushing at us with horrifying speed. ZOOMING DOWN we see dark opening. The wind howling around wings, we rush dizz into the aperture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN circles admiringly around DALE. VULTAN is a lusty viking of the sky, winged like his men, one eye blinded, beard cloven by an old scar from forehead to jaw. Gorgeou HAWKGIRLS watch jealously as VULTAN inspects DALE very closely, reaches out a sly hand and touches her bosom. DA slaps his hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out, you old bird -- Ming wants to marry me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN hoots at that as HAWKGIRLS murmur. He's about to touch her again when there is a CLAMOR o.s. VULTAN reacts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, DALE, FLASH, SARIN, VULTAN, ZARKOV, ZAAKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAWKMEN carrying FLASH, TIGER MAN and BARIN swoop OUT fro another hole like the one they dove into. The whole place like a great hanging birdhouse, HAWKWOMEN and HAWCHILDREN moving in and out and perching on the various exterior terraces. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and TIGER MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are dropped on to a terrace, so hard it stuns them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is lowered more carefully on another terrace, this one grander, with a throne in the center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying down from above, hovering above BARIN with menacin glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho! -- Barin! - I knew my Hawkmen would catch you one of these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful how you address me, Vultan. I am Prince Barin, ruler of Arboria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in my Kingdom -- here you're just a stray animal to be killed for our sport!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you do that, Vultan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do if you'd caught me in Arboria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- I would hunt you down and kill you without mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH on the OTHER TERRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lifts his head groggily, reacts to something. ANGLE TO INCLUDE ZARKOV, stumbling out from an opening in his usua clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello - we do meet in the strangest places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boss-bird has her up in his 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudden ear-piercing SCREAM from above. DALE'S scream, FLA bounds to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE is surrounded by jealous HAWKGIRLS who are pushing h toward the terrace edge. Screaming again, DALE goes OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH wheels toward the sound, dives to the parapet and catches DALE as she plunges past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash! Oh darling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hauls her in and they embrace in a steamy kiss. FLUTTE of wings. HAWKMEN swoop at the terrace and LIFT UP the clinging couple. It barely interrupts their conversation:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash -- when I was in that tub --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- it was me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you mean it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every thought, baby! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, DALE, FLASH, HAWKPEOPLE, TIGER MAN, VULTAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As FLASH and DALE are lowered on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. What have you to say to Vultan, Prince of the Air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all Ming's prisoners. I say let's team up and smash him.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER MAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Listen to his words! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his feet on the other terrace, shouting across: 58.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know -- I'm only an ignorant Tiger Man -- but I tell you Flash Gordon is the leader we've waited for!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where VULTAN gazes at TIGER MAN a beat, then turns mockin eyes on FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a leader, he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, back home it's what I'm paid for -- I called a pretty good game against the Dallas Cowboys once ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hunting him when you seized me. Before you finish me. Vultan I beg only that you let me finish him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god -- here we go again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everyone on Mongo CRAZY? Haven't you guys ever heard of TEAMWORK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I had that damn snake in my hand, I could've poked it in your face and KILLED you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had you in bow-sight you were dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! (shouting to all around) These vagrants talk a brave fight, my Hawkmen! Shall we test their words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHEERING AND SHOUTING eagerly from all around:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Test them! -- Let's have sport! The joust! -- To the joust! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them below -- put them together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN leads the way down. FLASH, BARIN, DALE, ZAAKOV and TIGER MAN are escorted by many fierce HAWKMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash - don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, bitter) I've got to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has no choice, Dale it's the Mongo way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so homesick -- what I wouldn't give for a nice quiet night with some muggers in Central Park --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH squeezes DALE'S hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead appears an archway opening to the sky. A GREAT GONG is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE - HAWKMAN appears with a mallet, he beats again on huge bronze GONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startling sight: A big DISC hangs in the air between the curved prongs of a lower terrace, the shaft that supports lost in clouds below. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and the OTHERS appear. They halt, looking at the di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is GREASING the shiny surface with a mop, slipping around bit as he does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS - ASH AND BARIN getting prepared. Removing shirts b equipped with heavy leather gauntlets, and so on. Each is given a long vicious WHIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE - a bridge-like plank extends itself, out over the edge of the shiny greased disc. FLASH and BARIN appear, r for combat. HAWKMEN behind them, wthey start out over the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arm the disc!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stopping short, eyes popping, as he SEES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Razor sharp knives are POPPING UP from the top surface al over, maybe two feet apart. If a man loses his footing an falls he will surely be fatally impaled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, DALE, FLASH, MING'S VOICE, VULTAN, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FEATURE FLASH and BARIN with whips in hand, they step fro the bridge onto the disc. FLASH almost slips and falls immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting his balance again. BARIN moves across amidst the knives, takes a stance facing FLASH, raises and coils bac his whip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for me, Earthling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ask you to swear, Barin -- if you defeat me, you'll join Vultan against Ming! If for no other reasons, because you'll never have Aura as long as her father lives!-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you now of Aura?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a lot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZWIPPP! BARIN'S whip lashes out savagely at FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the fight begins. FLASH and BARIN stalk around, slipping on the grease, whamming at each other with their whips. The disc suddenly begins to TILT and SWAY, making this affair even more desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN begins to get an edge. Slashing, cutting, he drives FLASH back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash, I love you! Win for me, Flash!??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrenaline courses through his veins as he hears that ove the uproar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flies at BARIN, dodges the lash, grapples with him han to-hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wrestle their way tot he very rim of the swaying til surface. It looks bad again for FLASH, when with a superh effort he flips BARIN over his back... over the edge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the same instant, FLASH dives onto his side amidst the deadly knives and grabs at BARIN'S wrist. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH catches him. BARIN hangs suspended over the abyss o space held only by FLASH'S grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've won, Earthling! Drop him to doom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping at BARIN) Try to catch my wrist! -- the other one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it what you want, Vultan -- compassion -- mercy: let us teach you the meaning of these words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swing your body -- see if you can get a leg up here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly an ECHOING VOICE BOOMS from the sky:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vultan! Hear Ming, Ruler of the Universe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, MING, MING'S VOICE, VULTAN, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where MING watches the SKY PALACE SCENE on a viewing scre a weeping AURA beside him, as he goes on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you, Vultan -- and Barin too! You both have defied we by sparing these Earthlings!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barin -- my only -- I swear I didn't mean to get you into this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the VOICE goes on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to live, Vultan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What creature wants to die? 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then kill Flash Gordon now! Pick up Dale Arden, deliver her to me on your own wings -- it's your only chance! My fleet is already in the air, ready to destroy your whole Kingdom if you disobey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ECHO rolls and dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGER MAN suddenly leaps out onto the disc, slides over between the knives, helps FLASH pull BARIN up to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV in his chains, walks over to the confused VULTAN..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll you have -- death or dishonor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN looks down at FLASH once more, then makes up his m He shouts to his people:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll save these Earthlings! - Curse Ming! -- Into the air, my Hawkpeople - fly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV grins, extends a hand to VULTAN. He just looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand this. I think I've gone mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, MING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING snaps off the viewing screen, looks at AURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare him Daddy -- oh please spare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA tries to throw herself into his arm, but he pushes h roughly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLYTUS materialises from a shadow, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've always wanted her, Klytus -- Aura is yours. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is being evacuated. Squadrons of HAWAKPEOPLE stream ou of its many openings, diminutive figures against the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several ROCKET-SHIPS appear, wonderfully gaudy contraptio with MING's battle-flags flying. A RAY shoots out from th nose of the biggest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RAY zaps it. The whole place EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH, VULTAN, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN and his CAPTAIN lead. Ranged around are BARIN, FLA DALE ,TIGER MAN and ZARKOV, each carried by a HAWKMAN. Di explosions rumble like thunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look back, Hawkman. Head for that cloud-cover! (over his shoulder) Where's this capsule of yours, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the high grass east of Mingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick it up, Captain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAPTAIN and a FEW HAWKMEN peel off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaze at each other lovingly, flown along about a hundred feet apart. He calls for her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess the first thing you and me are gonna do after we land..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling not in front of the Hawkmen -- you'll make me blush! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna do it first thing -- around here, never know if you'll get another chance! 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark SHADOW falls over DALE. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big ROCKET SHIP hovers, doors in its bottom side openin A flickering RAY shoots down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an effulgent GLOW envelopes her. Inexorably, DALE and her HAWKMEN are sucked upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming, Dale! (to his Hawkmen) Follow her -- climb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN's command of course takes precedence. The HAWKMAN bearing FLASH follows his mates into a shrieking vertical dive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, HEDONIA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE and her HAWKMAN are sucked up into a chamber. Waitin SOLDIERS seize the struggling HAWKMAN, brutally smash his wings pitch him OUT the bottom as the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE backs off, drops into a karate stance, With a WHININ ROAR the craft accelerates throwing DALE off balance agai a wall. HEDONIA enters through a door, her arms full seem to be yards and yards of filmy white material. HEDONIA Sm nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is short. Ming sent me to fit you with is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fit me with what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wedding dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TREE MEN and LION MEN and TIGER MAN toil together in peac concernt, constructing a crude wooden launch-gantry aroun ZARKOV'S SPACE CAPSULE, which has been conveyed here. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several hovering HAWKMEN hold it in position with vine ca as the work is completed. Capsule door is open. Through i we see ZARKOV at work inside, feverishly re-wiring a cont panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, FLASH, VULTAN, ZARKOV'S VOICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on Lodge Balcony, FLASH, BARIN and VULTAN lean over a table on which maps and drawings are laid out, a typical military staff meeting. With a bit of charcoal, BARIN ske a semi-circular line over a map of MING'S city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A force-field covers the whole city, from here to here. With luck, Flash can lure them into lowering their defenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he fails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is suicide, Barin! I can't order my men to suicide!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN ascends into the air. Hovers as he goes on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flight brought me back to my senses -- good luck and goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ming destroyed your kingdom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll build another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vultan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go -- I understand. (up to Vultan) Thanks anyway for getting us this far!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN hesitates a moment, the soars away with determinat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash! Ready for a test!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FLASH, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the game-plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit there. When I give you zero, punch that button. Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, FLASH'S VOICE, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV jumps out, leaving the door open. He crouches low. BARIN and VULTAN and EVERYBODY are watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five, four, three, two, one -- ZERO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interior of the capsule is filled with BLINDING BLUE LIGH for an instant. ZARKOV pops up, sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear me, Flash? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As INVISIBLE HANDS turn around the helmet on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eureka! I did it! You can come out now, Flash --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless you get out of my way, I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV moves inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- he still casts a shadow:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. FLASH is totally invisible, but on the ground SEE his shadow as he climbs out and stands upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there is rising WHINING HUMMING SOUND that seems fill the whole firmament. The earth trembles. LION MEN an TREE MEN cower in terror. TIGER MAN roars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zarkov! What have you done? 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND grows louder, intolerable. Brown smoking foliag rains down. EVERYONE looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (KLYTUS, VOICE, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The topless forest of Arboria is withering, falling apart TREE MEN cry with primal fear as the SEE the sky revealed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hovering against the sun are the dark shapes of MING'S RO SHIPS. PULSING RAYS emanate from projectors on their bott A VOICE booms from heave:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prisoners of Ming, you are surrounded! The creature who moves is obliterated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYONE stands frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howls in terror, makes a break for cover. A RAY instantly zaps down at him and he EXPLODES into fiery fragments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small SHUTTLE CRAFT descends vertically to a soft landi KLYTUS gets out. Every sound ceases. He nods at BARIN, at ZARKOV. Looks around. Frowns. He walks directly across FLASH'S SHADOW, to ZARKOV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find vultan later. Where's Flash Gordon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Hawkman dropped him. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AURA, DALE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo -- it's not true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is -- they saw him fall a mile into the glaciers of Frigia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE shuts her eyes, sobs out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Flash -- no -- you can't be dead -- it doesn't make any sense --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I think of being given to Klytus, I wish it was myself who had fallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blazing at her) I don't believe you. You -- you awful Mongo person -- you were born without a heart:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is it that melts into my eyes, Dale Arden? Feel it breaking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tear runs down AURA'S cheeks. She seizes DALE'S hand, pre it against her wonderful breast. DALE is really moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You poor kid -- don't you have a MOM to talk to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ming tired of her. He blew my Mother into outer space. I look into the night sky sometimes and wonder what star she's orbiting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Aura -- no wonder you've had problems -- that bastard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE embraces AURA. They cling to each other, bosom again bosom, in perfect womanly understanding. Golden CHORDS ar heard. Doors open. AMAZONS enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capsule sits in its launch-gantry, amidst the ruined blig left by the ray attack. There is not a soul in sight. The Flash's SHADOW moves quickly over the ground toward the Capsule and VANISHES into the hatch. The door shuts itsel 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control levers move. A red button depresses itself. Throu the side, which we should remember is transparent from wi we SEE the scene outside going into a GREEN-BROWN BLUR as the capsule starts to spin for takeoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (KLYTUS, MING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING is being robed by TWO GIRL ATTENDANTS. Suddenly KLYT is there in a shadow, smiling. MING senses him, turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? What is it this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remember. I feel danger -- but I cannot see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klytus, you're impossible. Aura deserves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I foresee another thing. In one minute exactly, the Earthling space capsule will be seen on the scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLYTUS is swallowed again in shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailing over the ever frozen Moon of FRIGIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CAPTIN, MING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capsule is SEEN on the viewing screen, grid-lines dancing over the image as FRIGORIA is left behind. Watching are M KLYTUS, the CAPTAIN and several other SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I disintegrate it, Your Majesty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Captain -- bring it in. Land it to a warm reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the front we see MING'S CITY dead ahead and below Numbers flash on the navigation display, constantly chang 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INVISIBLE HAND picks up a microphone, holds it before INVISIBLE LIPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vultan! Do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FLASH'S VOICE, VULTAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN and some other HAWKMEN perch, listening to VOICE c from a radio in VULTAN'S belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash Gordon calling Vultan! Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN doesn't stir a feather. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: FLASH'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, don't answer -- I'm on Hawkman frequency I know you are reading me. Now get this --

dialogues.speaker: FLASH'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm being guided through the force- field under their control. You're on the beam when you've got the tops of two towers lined up exactly -- the high gold one behind the green one with the blue flag got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Vultan, it's your decision the ball is in your court -- I hope I'll be seeing you, you crazy ole bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The microphone hangs itself up on the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sit there, grim-faced. VULTAN shake his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He calls us crazy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (GUARD CAPTAIN, KLYTUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an armed camp. SOLDIERS stand admits tanks and ray-g artillery, every weapon trained on a landing pad in the middle. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLYTUS waits with his CAPTAIN watching the mirror-bright capsule coming down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lands. CAPTAIN gives a signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZAP! From a tank's ray gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The capsule's door is knocked with surgical precision off its hinges. Flanked by SOLDIERS with ray-guns at the read the CAPTAIN advances and looks in. He turns and calls bac to KLYTUS in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's empty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unmanned. Must've taken off on some automatic program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLYTUS frowns. He doesn't notice the SHADOW that suddenly passes over him, moves on quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halts, shift shape as FLASH stops in dismay at that, turn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RAY GUN - ON A TANK ZAPS out a ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV'S CAPSULE - glows white, falls into thin ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lets out a bitter sigh. Then the SHADOW moves again, fast to an open doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FLASH' S VOICE, SOLDIER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stands on guard. Suddenly out of nowhere, but very close.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH' S VOICE
dialogues.text: Which way to the dungeons, Soldier:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third elevator down, turn left! (then doing a take) Who is that? 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! A left to the gut doubles him over to take an invis knockout right on the chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SOLDIERS stand with ray-guns before a heavy locked do Suddenly INVISIBLE FLASH steps behind a flaring torch, ca an enormous SHADOW on the wall. He manipulates his caped arms so that the image becomes truly fearsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the ghost of all the good men murdered by Ming! Prepare for doom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOLDIERS faint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR SOLDIERS march along, two by two, filling the narrow way. SOUND OF RUNNING FEET coming towards them. They halt i n consternation. WHAM! Invisible FLASH crashes into the sending them flying like bowling-pins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR GUARDS lounge. around. MOVE to one of them, who sits studying the pictures in the Mingo version of PLAYBOY magazine. A SHADOW falls over the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking at it now -- wait for your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INVISIBLE UPPERCUT knocks him off his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As INVISIBLE FLASH goes after the other three with a dead chair that seems to SWING itself through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV, BARIN and TIGER MAN lie in chains, heads cocked a SOUNDS of the facas outside. THUD of a body falling, brie silence, then sound of a KEY IN THE LOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me! 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, FLASH'S VOICE, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Same one AURA and FLASH fell down originally. Now BAR ZARKOV, TIGER MAN and FLASH are inching their way UP it l mountain climbers doing a rock chimney; in. back-to-back pairs, feet pressed out against the shaft walls. What mak it look even stranger, half of the FLASH-BARIN twosome is INVISIBLE. Low conversation as they pant and struggle up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get down to the plasma level?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anti-gravity shaft -- I got a guard to show me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This won't be easy, Flash --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's easy on Mongo --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTROLLER, GUARD CAPTAIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIZARD MEN SLAVES work like mad, shoveling radioactive fu into the seething mass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTROLLERS are at consoles. Many GUARDS stand around. Everyone watches a big hanging dial. Its needle quivers w each flare-up from the inferno below, inches toward a RED SECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster! -- More fueld!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTROLLER What's the hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to give Dale Arden the final destruction of Earth as a wedding present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTROLLERS twist the shock-knobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tortured SLAVES howl in agony. Some drop and are thrown i the fiery mass, others redouble their efforts. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The needle quivers upwards. MOVE OFF it to a slot-like wi in back wall. There are EYES behind the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, FLASH'S VOICE, TIGER MAN, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV,BARIN and TIGER MAN crouch amidst WHIRRING ventila watching through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it look to yoU?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad. Plasma's contracting into a critical mass. When that needle hits the red, Earth is finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grrao! I'll charge down at them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV and BARIN just look at him. TIGER MAN slumps out o his fighting stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low door at the back opens itself and INVISIBLE FLASH com in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavern is sealed tight -- every door locked from the inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope drains from his expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's face it, my friends -- without a miracle, we've lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (HAWKMAN CAPTAIN, VULTAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is filled with HAWKMEN, flying toward us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN and HIS CAPTAIN. fly in the lead, looking ahead an down at the City of Mingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right -- I see the towers lined up now as Flash Gordon said --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN soars up and hovers, shouts to the ranks behind: 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the force-field, my Hawkmen! The pass is narrow -- dive three-by- three! Any man who wishes to turn back may do so!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep flying right on, not one bird of them turning back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musing to his captain:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are these Earthlings, that so many would die for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must have one hell of a little

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE HAWKMEN are SEEN in steep descent. comes ,INTO FOCU over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK. Several OFFICERS and SOLDIERS are around a con watching the screen and other displays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another OFFICER touches a red firing-button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ranged here are devices like multiple rocket-launchers, bristling with hundreds of arrows. SWOOSH: One fires its load into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (HAWKMAN CAPTAIN, VULTAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE LEADING HAWKMEN are impaled a dozen times each crumple and plummet down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN and CAPTAIN - HOVERING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trap! The passage is covered! 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onward, Hawkmen! Dive! We outnumber their arrows -- overwhelm them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUTS - HAWKMEN and ARROW PROJECTORS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the brave HAWKMEN dive in a converging stream at the invisible opening, and the projectors FIRE again and agai Great slaughter is wreaked on the HAWKMEN, but they keep coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One group VEERS to the side away from the deadly fire, on to crash into the equally deadly force-field. They EXPLOD into flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRING OFFICER is almost breaking his thumb, he has it ja down so hard on the red button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE to the VIEWING SCREEN. On it VULTAN leads a stream descending HAWKMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Circle and reform, some giving mid-air aid to wounded mat and on they come, onward!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man the battlements!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAWKMEN descend as SOLDIERS rush out at them. The battle epic, a crazy combination of swords and ray-guns and club and spears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN is a towering figure in the middle of it, dealing havoc on all sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he fights THREE SOLDIERS, ANOTHER races at VULTAN'S ba with a deadly spear. Suddenly he TRIPS OVER NOTHING and crashes headlong to be dispatched by another HAWKMAN. VUL whirls and is amazed to have his freehand warmly clasped an INVISIBLE ONE. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (KLYTUS, MING, OFFICER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING and KLYTUS, in ceremonial robes. As part of his cost MING wears a sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the ring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door flies open, an OFFICER dashes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Majesty, we're under attack by Hawkmen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you doing down here, coward? Why aren't you in the fray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sire, I thought you'd --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mingo City is impregnable! I'm not about to put off wedding Dale Arden for this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FLASH'S VOICE, HAWKMAN CAPTAIN, VULTAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battle continues. Bloodies HAWKMAN CAPTAIN fights his way up beside VULTAN, who is engaged in seizing a dominan piece of ray-gun artillery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's for us after this lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cavern first! Gotta get Zarkov in there to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly MUSIC is heard from below. Some great electronic organ booms out the strains of what is recognizably "Here Come The Bride".... the familiar thrilling wedding-march.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On my god! 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magnificent wedding is on. DALE marches slowly up the middle, on KLYTUS'S arm, helped along by AMAZONS who marc at her back with spears. Her long train passes between th AMAZONS to be borne behind by LOVELY GIRLS, as the party passes between ranks of splendidly garbed MONGONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aged HIGH PRIEST waits at the throne-altar with MING, whose eyes lecherously devour his approaching bride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her beauty only enhanced by the teas rolling soundlessly down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The molten mass is more intense than we have ever seen it scarcely bearable to the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (TIGER MAN, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even in here there is a terrible glare from the slot-wind ZARKOV turns his face away suddenly, infinitely sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't watch any more. To think of all our history ended this way -- the incredible ascent from primordial slime to Albert Einstein and Dale Arden and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VULTAN and THREE HAWKMEN are swooping down from some gall above. VULTAN and TWO pounce on CONTROLLERS, while the TH HAWKMAN flies down to open a door on the lower level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV and BARIN and TIGER MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scramble for the low exit behind them. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH'S VOICE, HIGH PRIEST, MING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth turns slowly in mid-air, its seas and continents ve by clouds of hideous smoke which seethe with flashes of interior red lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then FACES come INTO FOCUS below and behind it, and we re we are in MING' S GREAT HALL, where EARTH is a holographi image in a transparent box above the altar-throne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing beside MING at the altar with KLYTUS, looking up despairingly at her beloved planet while the HIGH PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you take her, this Earthling, Dale Arden, to be your Empress of the hour? Do you solemnly promise to use her as you will -- not discard her until such time as you grow weary of her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wedding ring, please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLYTUS produces a golden ring, hands it to MING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING takes DALE'S left hand, forces it up into position, holds the ring poised to slip it on. MING'S face has neve been more merciless.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Recite after me -- with this ring I thee wed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this ring, I thee wed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INVISIBLE HAND snatches the ring from MING'S grip like lightning and james it onto DALE'S finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium. DALE runs like hell, but is tripped by her t and goes down as MING leaps up onto his throne platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seal this hall! Close every portal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swinging shut, BARIN squeezing in through it at the last instant, sword in hand. KLYTUS rushes at him with a sword his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks around wildly, whipping out the sword sheathed at h belt. Its blade is like crystal fire. He reacts sharply, catches his breath.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER SWORD
dialogues.text: (FLASH'S VOICE, MING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: exactly like his, a blade of fire, apparently hanging in air and pointed right at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get that sword?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the crystal block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible! It could only be pulled by my rightful heir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sword slowly advances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face contorted, he flies at INVISIBLE FLASH behind th sword. FLASH parries the blow. Astonishing pyrotechnics a the blades hit each other. Shrieking MONGONS flee under showers of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAWKMEN and LIZARD MEN SLAVES engage MING'S PEOPLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aided by VULTAN and TIGER MAN, ZARKOV battles his way up the Mezzanine Control area. He shouts down wildly: 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attach the electrodes to the shovels! Pitch them into the plasma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BARIN, DALE, KLYTUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MING and FLASH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duel dazzlingly around the enormous throne. Suddenly FLAS starts to lose his invisibility. A pair of eyes appears, the tip of a nose, parts of limbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinned by AMAZONS, reacting to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash -- look out -- you're coming back! He can see you now, Flash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and MING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH pauses to look at himself, almost gets his head lop off by a fiery slash from MING, recovers to bound up high on the vast throne statue wheron they battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL UP. In the f.g. the image of EARTH slowly turns and glows redder with the lightning inside the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN and KLYTUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duel in another area of e Hall. A thrust by BARIN catches KLYTUS on the forehead. KLYTUS springs back, blood gushin down over his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I foresaw at blow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're blinded, Klytus -- drop your sword!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLYTUS laughs, reaches up and throws off his helmet, WHIR in a lightning way to reveal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadowed, hideous, marked with all the evil in the univer It's mouth emits a raging SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunges with horror, slashes with his sword point. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is slashed but grotesquely does not bleed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARIN and KLYTUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fly at each other again, trade blows, then each catches a wrist of the other with his free hand. KLYTUS laughs horribly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fight me in vain, Barin I do not foresee my death at your hands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLYTUS twists away, knocks BARIN'S sword out of his grasp drives BARIN back against the wall. KLYTUS lifts his own sword, puts it at BARIN'S throat for the final thrust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly changes horribly. PULL BACK. AURA is behind him, her hand on the hilt of BARIN'S sword, which she has driv into KLYTUS' back. Soundless, dead, KLYTUS falls to the f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURA and BARIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move together, embrace. BARIN touches her face. Gently, A strokes BARIN'S cheek in hirst human-like, loving touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH and MING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have duelled their way right up onto the shoulder of the great statue now, fight against a vast replica of MING'S EAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needle trembles on the verge of red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE DOWN to ZARKOV at console, protected against the fi GUARDS' onslaught by VULTAN and TIGER MAN as he works feverishly with a screwdriver on a wiring panel pulled ou from the innards He straightens up, takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross your fingers, boys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZARKOV hits a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ALL THE MONGONS, DALE, DALE'S VOICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reacting to something, pointing upward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- Earth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's so beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he swivels his head for a quick look. He freezes, give a CRY of unmitigated rage. FLASH seizes the instant, thru his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blade goes into MING up to the hilt. FLASH pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't a drop of blood. MING just stands there , smo in spectacular fashion into the atoms of which he was constituted. MING is just GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYONE looks upwards at FLASH, standing with his sword atop the statue. There is a clatter as AMAZONS cast away their spears. A cry goes up as if from one throat!

dialogues.speaker: ALL THE MONGONS
dialogues.text: Hail, Flash Gordon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vista of stunning beauty as HAWKMEN soar and loop in wond victory rolls, leaving behind RAINBOW CONTRAILS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DALE, FLASH, ZARKOV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a scene of peace now. HAWKMEN and SOLDIERS join in tending their wounded. Formerly fierce AMAZONS act as gen nurses. MOVE OVER this to find FLASH, DALE and ZARKOV sta together, looking up at the terrific sky-shadow, FLASH wi an arm around DALE'S shoulder. He glances at her tenderly is surprised to see tears on her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saved Earth but we lost the capsule -- we'll never get home again. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zarkov is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you fellows be leaving on your honeymoon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE laughs, turns her face up to FLASH. He kisses her. A they head into the Palace, ZARKOV gazes upward again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAWKMEN swoop and soar, weaving RAINBOWS, as END CREDITS ROLL.
